did.abstract: The Harvey D. Burrill dispatches relate to conditions in England and France after World War I and the Paris Peace Conference of 1919. There is a special emphasis on citizens from Syracuse, NY who were abroad, as the dispatches were written for the Syracuse Journal.

chronitem.event: Born in Geddis, Onondaga County, NY
Entered the law office of Theodore E. Hancock
Became a reporter for the Syracuse Journal
Served on the Syracuse Board of Supervisors as assistant clerk (1895-1900) and clerk (1901)
Became city editor for the Syracuse Journal
Became an editorial writer and the managing editor for the Syracuse Journal
Became the editor and general manager for the Syracuse Journal
Served as Chairman of the Victory Loan Publicity Committee in Syracuse
Died in Syracuse, Onondaga County, NY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Harvey D. Burrill dispatches relate to the Paris Peace Conference of 1919 and conditions in England, France, and occupied territories after World War I. The dispatches report on rationing, demilitarization, inflation, status of aid/relief efforts, and US-European relations. Included are also battlefield descriptions and first-hand accounts of battles from soldiers. There is a special emphasis on citizens from Syracuse, NY who were abroad, as the dispatches were written for the Syracuse Journal.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Statement
arrangement.p: The dispatches are organized chronologically in a bound volume.
